copan:CORE model design

NEWS: Jobst added a software implementation concept based on last week’s discussions!

Suggested procedure:

  • Everyone uses track changes / “Vorschlagen” mode and comments to suggest additions, deletions or modifications
  • DO NOT REJECT suggestions of others here before they were discussed!
  • In modeling meetings, the design team discusses them and accepts or rejects the changes!
  • Before editing, please make sure by reading the whole document that you edit at the right position in the document!
  • Use rather more than less structure by headlines and bullet point hierarchies
  • The document structure was chosen pragmatically but was given some thought, so please let’s not debate too much about the document structure but focus on the contents!
  • Use italics for key concepts and newly defined terms (as in math texts)

The first draft of this document was assembled by Jobst based on his understanding of what we agreed to tentatively.

At some later point when track changes/comments are getting less frequent and formulae get more mathematically involved, we should migrate the document to Overleaf.

  • Content
  • Dimensions
    • Time, events
    • Space
    • Other physical dimensions
  • Stochasticity, noise
  • Entities and their main state variables
    • Individuals
    • Individual links
    • Cells
    • “Societies” (=metabolic groups)
    • The “planet”
    • Other entities not modelled yet but maybe later
  • Processes and their representation
    • Resources, metabolism, economy
    • Social dynamics on the individual, intra-societal level
    • Social dynamics between individuals not restricted to the same society
    • Social dynamics on the society level / between societies
  • Modularization, interfaces
  • Software implementation
    • NEW: Structure as developed in last week of October 2016:
    • Old thoughts:
  • Actual equations
  • Experiments
    • Individual runs for specific parameters and initial conditions
    • Monte-Carlo simulations for specific parameters and initial conditions
    • Monte-Carlo simulations for specific parameters but varying initial conditions
    • Monte-Carlo simulations with varying parameters and initial conditions
  • First Concrete Proposal (Jobst)
    • Remarks
  • Research Questions
